<<<<<<< HEAD
Vox cæli; or, philosophical, historicall, and theological [brace] observations, of thunder. With a more general view of Gods wonderful works. First grounded on Job 26. 14. but now enlarged into this treatise. / By Robert Dingley, M.A. once fellow of Magdalen Colledge in Oxford; now minister of Gods Word at Brixton in the Isle of Wight, and County of Southampton. Dingley, Robert, 1619-1660.
[38], 144, 143-174 p.
Printed by M S. for Henry Cripps, and are to be sold at his shop in Popes-head Alley, London, : 1658.
Text is continuous despite pagination. The words "philosophical .. theological" are bracketed together on title page. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[38], 144, 143-174 p.
Printed by M S. for Henry Cripps, and are to be sold at his shop in Popes-head Alley, London, : 1658.
